data.title: Weather in Zagreb in April
data.meta_description: Discover the average weather, temperature and general climate of Zagreb in april. Find cheap flights in april and plan your trip to Zagreb on Avionero
data.text:
Going from a maximum of +73°F during the day to a minimum of +28°F during the night, the temperature in April averages around +59°F.

The average maximum temperature goes up 8% by the end of the month, compared with the beginning of the month, from +64°F to +68°F.

Zagreb is typically mild in April.

Maximum temperatures go up compared to the previous month from +54°F to +63°F. The minimum temperature also goes up from +36°F to +43°F.

Pack a light jacket as it will be warm in the day and cool in the evenings.

Take a look at how April is compared to other months in Zagreb:

April weather is still as good as in March. It’s getting warmer as April arrives. The average maximum temperature goes up from +54°F to +63°F during the day. Prepare for more rain. Average rainfall goes from 51 mm to 68 mm. It feels drier, as humidity decreases from 69% to 67%. The average wind speed doesn’t change much during April, staying around 2 m/s. The amount of sunny days stay about the same, averaging 9 sunny days during the month.

May brings much the same weather, it remains good.

The average wind speed is 2 m/s getting up to 7 m/s which is a medium breeze. You can feel it, especially getting out of the water.

The average wind speed in Zagreb is gradually increasing during April, going from 2 m/s to 2 m/s over the course of the month.

The climate in Zagreb in April has not changed that much over the last 43 years.

The average temperature was the lowest in 1980 (+57°F) and the highest in 2022 (+65°F). The driest year was 2011 with only 471 mm of rainfall, and the wettest year was 2019 with 1707 mm.

For this page, we’ve looked at the typical weather in Zagreb, based on historical hourly weather data from January 1, 1979, to December 31, 2022.

For past dates, we show actual recorded data at the location at that time. Forecasts are based on recorded weather during that day of the year, averaged over the total years for which we have records (unless stated otherwise). The daily temperature is the highest recorded temperature in the shadow during that day.
